intro: Tribulus decolor, commonly known as the yellow ballflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Zygophyllaceae and is characterized by its yellowish-green flowers and spiny, branched stems. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in sandy or rocky soils. Its small, clustered flowers are followed by bright orange or red fruits that contain several seeds. Tribulus decolor is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
